content.data: The "Positional" parameters are: X, Y, and Z, these parameters are used to record the position of an object, in relation to its parent object, such as an Assembly on a Wall, or a Part in an Assembly. The Wall would be the parent for the Assembly, and the Assembly would be the parent for the Part.

The left and right position of an object, also called its X position. A positive adjustment will move the object to the right of its parents "Reference Point", while a negative adjustment will move the object to the left of its parents "Reference Point". For example if the X position of a Cabinet were 23" (X = 23), we would know that the Cabinet was 23" from the left end of the Wall (toward the right end of the Wall). See the diagram below.

The up and down position of an object, also called its Y position. A positive adjustment will move the object up from its parents reference point, while a negative adjustment will move the object down from it parents reference point. For example if the Y position of a Cabinet were 23" (Y = 23) we would know that the Cabinet was raised 23" off the floor. See the diagram below.
Z = Front to Back (or In and Out)

The front to back position of an object, also called its Z position. A positive adjustment will move the object forward from its parents reference point, while a negative adjustment will move the object backward from its parents reference point. For example if the Z position of a Cabinet was 23" (Z = 23) we would know that the Cabinet was 23" away from the face of the Wall. See the diagram below.
